intro: Gussonea cornuta, commonly known as the horned gussonea, is a rare and intriguing member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, adding to its subtle aesthetic. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Gussonea cornuta is considered a rare and endangered species.
